newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraqi Kurd leader threatens to bring in Baghdad.
newsitem.headline: Iraqi Kurd leader threatens to bring in Baghdad.

text.p: Iraqi Kurdish leader Massoud Barzani said on Thursday he may ask Baghdad for help against the rival Patriotic Union of Kurdistan (PUK) militia.
"If the Kurdish people are under hard pressure of the PUK, we will ask for help from Iraq," Barzani told a news conference at his residence near the northern town of Salahuddin.
He repeated accusations that Iran had helped his rival take back much of northern Iraq from his forces this week.
"If Iran has the right to support the PUK, why shouldn't we have the right to demand support from Iraq?" he said.
There were no signs on Thursday of an Iraqi military presence around Salahuddin.
Iraqi tanks and troops helped Barzani take the key city of Arbil from the PUK in August, prompting U.S. missile attacks on military targets in southern Iraq.
PUK forces have closed in on Arbil in recent days.
Barzani said he was not willing to hold direct talks with PUK leader Jalal Talabani, despite U.S. mediation attempts.
"No," he said when asked if he would sit at the negotiating table with his longtime rival. "If they want, the U.S. can play a role in the region," he said.
Officials from the two warring parties were to meet U.S. officials in Washington later on Thursday. The United States fears any increase in Iranian or Iraqi influence in northern Iraq.
